labels.analysis: The Azure DevOps Integration Server focuses on providing access and management capabilities for Microsoft's Azure DevOps platform through an MCP interface. It allows users to track work items, manage repositories, plan sprints, conduct tests, perform security scans, and handle artifacts. The server also enables AI-assisted development operations, suggesting a strong automation component. The core functionality revolves around software development lifecycle management and Azure platform integration.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen due to the server's core functionality centered around development operations, workflow automation, and code management, all of which are fundamental in a development workflow. The secondary labels are selected because the server involves interaction with code repositories (Database Operations, though this could also be considered version control) and the use of AI for development tasks (AI/ML Tools). No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover its functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Azure DevOps Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mgprogm/azuredevops-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide seamless access to Azure DevOps work items, repositories, projects, boards, and sprints through a standardized MCP interface. Manage and automate Azure DevOps operations such as work item tracking, code repository management, sprint planning, testing, security scans, artifact management, and AI-assisted development. Enable AI assistants and tools to interact with Azure DevOps services efficiently and securely.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mgprogm/azuredevops-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
